CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in New Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, September 9, 1972, pg. 1 reads: "Prison Strike - Some 40 demonstrators marched at Western Penitentiary in support of a statewide prison work stoppage. By the court of the state Bureau of Correction, some 1000 prisoners went on strike Sept. 5 at 3 institutions including 150 at Western Penitentiary.  The strike is to dramatize a list of 41 grievances dealing with prison conditions and policies.  Extra guards were stationed at the front gate (left) in anticipation of demonstrators at Western Pen... -Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Prison guards, and demonstrators, including one holding sign reading "End Racial Discrimination," standing outside of Western Penitentiary
